assign1
Class Armstrong

java.lang.Object
  assign1.Armstrong

public class Armstrong
extends java.lang.Object

The Armstrong class is used to find the largest Armstrong number below a limit and digest the found number by finding its prime factors and display its bit pattern.

public static boolean isArmstrong3(int n)
The method is to determine if a number n is an Armstrong number of three digits

Parameters:

Returns:
the result that the given number is a three-digit Armstrong number

findPrimeFactor

public static void findPrimeFactor(int in_num)
The method is used to find and print all the factors of the given number. The factors are printed to the standard output with the following format: n1Xn1Xn2Xn3Xn3X....

Parameters:
in_num - A given number to be factored

printBitPattern

public static void printBitPattern(int num)
The method is to used to print the bit pattern of a given number. The bits are grouped with a space between 4 bits.

Parameters:
num - The given number to be converted into bit pattern.
